title: How Many Calories in a Slice of Bacon?

h1: How Many Calories in a Slice of Bacon?
assumptions: One slice of cooked, pan-fried pork bacon (~8 g), standard thickness, no added seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, cut thickness, cooking method, and fat content. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One slice of cooked bacon contains about 43 kcal and 3 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of bacon?
faqs.a: Approximately 43 kcal for a standard cooked slice.
Yes, one slice has 3.3 g total fat, including 1.1 g saturated.

faqs.q: How much sodium in a slice of bacon?
faqs.a: About 192 mg per slice, which can add up in meals.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in bacon?
faqs.a: Yes, frying adds more fat than baking or microwaving.
